api/Zigurous.Tweening.LoopType.html.title: Enum LoopType | Tweening
api/Zigurous.Tweening.LoopType.html.keywords: Enum LoopType A type of loop style. Namespace : Zigurous.Tweening Syntax public enum LoopType Fields Name Description PingPong Plays the tween forwards then backwards then forwards then backwards, etc. PingPongWithDelay Plays the tween forwards then backwards then forwards then backwards, etc. If the tween has a delay it will be delayed again each loop. Restart Restarts the tween from the beginning after it ends. RestartWithDelay Restarts the tween from the beginning after it ends. If the tween has a delay it will be delayed again each loop.

api/Zigurous.Tweening.Tween.html.title: Class Tween | Tweening
api/Zigurous.Tweening.Tween.html.keywords: Class Tween A tween object, an animation that changes a value over time using an easing function. Inheritance System.Object Tween Sequence Tweener<T> Namespace : Zigurous.Tweening Syntax public abstract class Tween Fields delay The amount of seconds the tween waits before playing after being started. Declaration public float delay duration The amount of seconds the tween takes to complete. Declaration public float duration ease The easing function type used by the tween to animate values. Declaration public Ease ease id An identifier that can be used to distinguish the tween from others. This is not explicitly required nor is it necessarily unique. The id is often used to identify which object the parameter being animated belongs to, and often that object is animating multiple parameters. Declaration public int id loops The number of times the tween loops. A value of -1 will loop the tween infinitely. Declaration public int loops loopType The style in which the tween loops. Declaration public LoopType loopType onComplete The callback invoked when the tween is completed. Declaration public TweenCallback onComplete onKill The callback invoked when the tween is killed. Declaration public TweenCallback onKill onLoop The callback invoked when the tween is looped. Declaration public TweenCallback onLoop onStart The callback invoked when the tween is started. Declaration public TweenCallback onStart onStop The callback invoked when the tween is stopped. Declaration public TweenCallback onStop onUpdate The callback invoked every time the tween is updated, i.e., any time the parameter being animated is changed. Declaration public TweenCallback onUpdate Properties autoKill Automatically kills the tween after being completed. Declaration public bool autoKill { get; set; } autoStart Automatically starts the tween after being created. Declaration public bool autoStart { get; set; } delayElapsed The amount of seconds that have elapsed during the tween's delayed state, when applicable. Declaration public float delayElapsed { get; } elapsed The amount of seconds that have elapsed since the tween started. Declaration public float elapsed { get; } IsComplete Whether the tween is complete. Declaration public bool IsComplete { get; } IsDelayed Whether the tween is currently in a delayed state, i.e., the tween has been started but the elapsed time has not exceeded the delay duration. Declaration public bool IsDelayed { get; } IsKilled Whether the tween is killed. Declaration public bool IsKilled { get; } IsPlaying Whether the tween is playing. Declaration public bool IsPlaying { get; } IsStopped Whether the tween is stopped. Declaration public bool IsStopped { get; } iterations The number of times the tween has completed. Declaration public int iterations { get; } PercentComplete The tween's percentage of completion. Declaration public float PercentComplete { get; } recyclable Keeps the tween in memory to be re-used after being killed. Declaration public bool recyclable { get; set; } reversed Animates from the end value to the start value as opposed to animating from the start value to the end value like normal. Declaration public bool reversed { get; set; } snapping Smoothly snaps all interpolated values to integers. Declaration public bool snapping { get; set; } state The animation state of the tween. Declaration public TweenState state { get; } Methods Animate() Animates the parameter being tweened to the current state. Declaration public abstract void Animate() Complete() Completes the tween, jumping to the end value. Declaration public void Complete() IsFinished() Declaration protected virtual bool IsFinished() Returns Type Description System.Boolean Kill() Kills the tween in its place, preventing any further state changes or changes to the parameter being animated. Declaration public void Kill() OnComplete() Declaration protected virtual void OnComplete() OnKill() Declaration protected virtual void OnKill() OnLoop() Declaration protected virtual void OnLoop() OnReset() Declaration protected virtual void OnReset() OnResume() Declaration protected virtual void OnResume() OnStart() Declaration protected virtual void OnStart() OnStop() Declaration protected virtual void OnStop() OnUpdate() Declaration protected virtual void OnUpdate() Play() Plays the tween, whether starting for the first time or resuming from a stopped state. Declaration public void Play() Restart() Restarts the tween as along as it has not been killed. Declaration public void Restart() Stop() Stops the tween if currently being played. Declaration public void Stop()

changelog/CHANGELOG.html.title: Changelog | Tweening
changelog/CHANGELOG.html.keywords: Changelog All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. The format is based on Keep a Changelog , and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning . [2.4.0] - 2021/06/28 Added New TweeningSettings component that can be used to change settings in the editor Changed Hide TweenManager in component menu Settings properties have been renamed [2.3.0] - 2021/06/27 Added Support for tweening Rect values New Material tween extensions New Camera tween extensions Changed Optimized memory consumption using enum flags Removed Removed Tweening.killTweensOnSceneUnload setting. Each tween now tracks the scene index and is automatically killed when that scene is unloaded. [2.2.1] - 2021/06/18 Fixed Removed editor only property tweens [2.2.0] - 2021/06/15 Added Setting to kill tweens when the scene is unloaded (default=true) [2.1.0] - 2021/06/09 Added Support for looping Support for snapping Support for reversing sequences [2.0.1] - 2021/06/07 Fixed Fix meta file reference error [2.0.0] - 2021/05/25 Changed Overhauled internal code to be more optimized and memory efficient Sequences can now be controlled and managed the same way as any other tween Added Hundreds of pre-defined extension methods for tweening properties on common Unity objects More generic types are now compatible with the tweening system [1.0.1] - 2021/04/13 Changed Package name and description [1.0.0] - 2021/03/24 Added Scripts Ease EaseFunction Sequence Settings Tween Tween+Chaining Tweener TweenState TweenUpdater Tweenable Objects Audio Camera CanvasGroup Graphic Light SpriteRenderer TextMesh Transform

manual/index.html.title: Tweening | Tweening
manual/index.html.keywords: Tweening The Tweening package provides a system for tweening object properties in Unity. A tween is an animation of a value from a start position to an end position using an easing function, providing a natural sense of motion. The system is lightweight, optimized, type-safe, and memory efficient. Hundreds of pre-defined tweening functions can be called on many common Unity objects, or you can animate anything using generic tweening functions. Tweens can be controlled with many different control methods and various callback functions.

manual/installation.html.title: Installation | Tweening
manual/installation.html.keywords: Installation Use the Unity Package Manager to install the Tweening package. Open the Package Manager in Window > Package Manager Click the add ( + ) button in the status bar Select Add package from git URL from the add menu Enter the following Git URL in the text box and click Add: https://github.com/zigurous/unity-tweening-package.git For more information on the Package Manager and installing packages, see the following pages: Unity’s Package Manager Installing from a Git URL Importing Import the package namespace in each script you want to use it. You may need to regenerate project files/assemblies first. using Zigurous.Tweening; Source Code The source code for the Tweening package is in the following repository: https://github.com/zigurous/unity-tweening-system
